PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE  
PRÆSIDIAD  (Ow ned by Carlyle) , London /  Hybrid  Aug 2022  – Present  
World market leader for force protection solutions, integrated perimeter security systems and industrial mesh production and 
fencing products , with manufacturing facilities in the US, Belgium, Poland, Italy, Germany, Türkiye , China and South Africa . 
Commercial and Operational Finance Director  
Drove  impact ful commercial growth, pricing, margin, manufacturing productivity, sourcing, repositioning, and cash  
flow  through KPI tracking and a solid management operating system. Ownership of full end -to-end responsibilities 
for commercial, FP&A, cost accounting, treasury, AP, G/L, AR, audit and shared service centers . 
▪ Boosted  US revenue growth of over 41% and EBITDA of 180% through the introduction  of a new bid process, 
price  hike , substantial  52% margin improve ment , cost deviation reduction and enhanced inventory management.   
▪ Raised liquidity levels.  Injected additional working capital into the business through innovation within the Accounts  
Receivable process , including  the implementation of 40% customer down payments and upgraded  collection.  
▪ Drove cost optimization  initiatives.  Streamlined expenditures via office closures and subsequent renegotiation 
of exits with landlords. Championed a flexible  / remote  working model that reduce d office -related expenditure.  
▪ Enhanced financial stability. Secured enterprise financial security by leading negotiation s with suppliers and 
crafting  payment plans t hat aligned with the firm’s financial obligations in a period of low liquidity.  
▪ Sharpened performance management. Stimulated gains in workforce delivery and performance with the 
introduction of a new Operating Model, targeted KRIs and KPIs, and launch of new Power BI reports.  
▪ Promoted a goal -aligned culture. Reimagined workforce delivery and performance objectives through the 
introduction of a targeted bonus structure t hat support ed the critical delivery of business goals and performance.  
▪ Reinvigorated and restructured the division. Significantly increased operational effectiveness and performance 
by building a robust, dynamic and engaged team that emphasized  cross -divisional collaboration.  
▪ Championed improved employee engagement to lower attrition. Maximi zed productivity through the launch of 
an initiative to support staff development, communicate a clear vision and establish structure.  
▪ Installed as interim EMEA COO. Pivotal  to the debt refinancing in August 2023, with the primary responsibility to 
coordinate due diligence and liaise with external advisors.
